answers.answer: I don't know what town your from but I have spent some years in the detroit area and here the addict gets no compassion.......If you an alcholic the nurse will give you meds for it but an addict has to fend for him or herself and it is a miserable way to detox let me tell you..........

From what I hear it varies from state to state so your best bet is to call the specific jail and ask... also, if you dont like the answer, appeal to the judge, it may be possible to get a court order about your meds.
not likely that they will even care if you are in jail. I've known many people who have had to get off even heroin c/t in jail

My 25 year old son detoxed (from what drug I don't know..to this day he hasn't told me) in jail in Cherokee County, GA.  Wasn't pleasant he said.  However, he did get introduced to NA and in the 3 months he's been out he's been clean and hasn't missed a meeting.Jim
Jim--Congrats to your son---you must be so proud of him...r2r
Hey it may be good that they don't get help they'll be off the drugs once and for all..It will suck, but in the long run it would be good...Thats my positive way of looking at it.

the problem with that is it takes time.........no judge is going to see you about getting some help with W/Ds.......so you and your room mate if you have one will suffer big time for three to five days.........

I'll be honest with you I detoxed in jail like 6 times and never got any help from a nurse.......and the one time I asked for it all it got me was restrictions......they watched me, ,couldn't play basketball, wasn't allowed to go to the library..........etc......couldnt' be a trustee.......Some jails now if your a long time Heroin user are starting to help because of the potential of seizures............but to answer your question no, your left to detox on your own and it sucks..........
Even in this day in age they still let a heroin user go c/t in jail. I've known many girls who were actually pregnant, addicted to opiates, and they still let them suffer there..

Legalities do take time but are well worth it if you win...where I live the prison system learned the hard way by leaving addicts to themselves and a few dead bodies later became convinced to try another approach. Methadone is now given in small but effective doses to the addict using a tapering method while monitoring for additional health concerns. The court here does not consider it frivolous to listen to anyone with a legitimate request. And to anwser your question, they should dispense legitmate prescriptions to anyone who needs them, but again, I would call ahead to the specific jail to make sure.
yeah it dumb that they do that. My b-friend had all four wisdom teeth pulled out in prison and the dentist prescribed some vikes, but they wouldn't give them to him

Thank you R2R...considering what he's been through in the last year, I'm very proud of him.  It's interesting that he and I can discuss depression and he understands, having been through it, and can discuss addiction having been through it and he's been an encouragement to me.  I only wish I could see him more often :-(I'm slowly getting over my "panic attack" stage when I have to go somewhere, so perhaps soon I'll be going to GA to see himJim
